Description:
Job OverviewAs a part of Creative Research team, you will work in the intersection of game development and data science areas. Your role will be to deliver state-of-the-art Machine Learning solutions for our game development processes. The ideal candidate won’t just help us to solve tasks, you will bring a new knowledge and experience to the team. As a subject matter expert, you will be combining your professional experience and an intrinsic desire for problem solving, with your passion of games in order to explore a new frontier within the realm of game development with our data scientists and academic research partners.

We are looking for a new team member with strong interpersonal skills and a combination of analytical skills, intellectual curiosity and accountability. The ideal candidate is intelligent, sharp, detail-oriented, and highly quantitative individual with a passion for gaming, data modeling, analysis, and working with cross-functional teams.

What will you do?• Analyze... data and apply researching, designing, prototyping and productization of machine learning solutions to challenge various business issues in game development
• Prepare documentation in a simple, understandable way for a business or technical audience
• Develop specifications for created models for further automation
• Design, prototype, and implement advanced machine learning algorithms to help improve player experiences. Work with data science and engineering team to implement robust processes in real time
• Review relevant academic and industry research to identify useful algorithms, techniques, libraries, etc. Monitor latest Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence trends and cutting-edge technics to leverage them on our projects
• Frame and conduct intricate analyses and experiments using extremely large, complex (not always well-structured, highly variable) data sets, analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
• Create statistical models and machine learning algorithms that provide insights and direction for overall game feature design and level design
• Research, implement and improve Machine Learning solutions to improve our game production processes or players experience
• Modify game code to allow effective implementation of ML algorithms
• Develop tools and processes that will help team members and stakeholders analyze experiment results
• Collaborate with other ML and game teams to industrialize Machine Learning solutions into innovative products and business processes

What are we looking for?• Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, data mining, etc)
• Proven solid commercial programming experience with developing machine learning systems in a professional environment
• Understanding of the mathematical foundations of machine learning algorithms,knowledge of probability theory and mathematical statistics
• Proficiency in Python and multiple libraries (NumPy, OpenCV, XGBoost, Scikit-Learn, Pandas, etc.), in data models and architectures
• Experience using machine learning frameworks (Pytorch, Tensorflow, MxNet, Caffe, etc.)
• Teamwork experience, ability to work independently as well as in small teams with minimal supervision
• Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical team members
• Intermediate or higher level of English

What additional skills will help you stand out?• Experience in game development industry
• Experience with Reinforcement Learning, Generative Adversarial Network, NLP and other state of the art techniques
• Experience with other programming languages (C++, C#, R, etc.)
• Familiarity with data extraction across different database architectures (structured and non-structured)
• Experience with CUDA, cuDNN
• Experience with cloud data/data processing services
• Advanced data visualization skills
• Experience in creating analytical reports in English and Russian

About Wargaming Wargaming is an award-winning online game developer and publisher headquartered in Nicosia, Cyprus. Operating since 1998, Wargaming has become one of the leaders in the gaming industry with 15 offices worldwide, including studios in Chicago, Prague, Shanghai, Tokyo, and Vilnius. Our diverse and multicultural team works together to deliver a top-class experience to millions of players who enjoy Wargaming's titles across all major gaming platforms. Our flagship products include free-to-play hits World of Tanks, World of Warships and World of Tanks Blitz.

Please see Wargaming Candidate Privacy Policy for details on how Wargaming uses your personal data

We are an early-stage startup SOULA, working on a personalized educational and emotional support App for mothers during and after pregnancy.

We want to create a Virtual Assistant, providing women with information, support, and useful practices to prepare for birth and postpartum, with a special emphasis on mental and emotional well-being.

Soula_Demo https://youtu.be/9YH8G4mCe2A

We are looking for an experienced and autonomous ML engineer to work on specializing in a Large Language Model (e.g., GPT-3) for a mobile App - a Virtual Assistant for pregnant women.

We are building a productive team focused on creating an exceptional product.

Responsibilities:
• Develop a prod workflow to specialize Large Language Models (e.g., GPT-3) to meet prod quality bar, develop workflow for continuous model finetuning to improve quality and mitigate low-quality, off-topic answers and/or hallucinations.
• Work closely with content and domain experts to create eval and finetuning data set
• Analyze... business problems and look at current and possible tools to speed up the path to production
• Lead the end-to-end ML product lifecycle
• Optimization of cloud costs, e.g., enable caching mechanisms, reduce number of API calls, optimize model size, etc.
• Work in SCRUM team, active participation in all Agile processes

We expect:
• Hands on experience with developing state-of-the-art models for NLP tasks
• MSc (preferably PhD) in ML, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related fields
• 3+ years of work experience in developing and productionizing state-of-the-art NLP models
• Experience with LLM fine-tuning (e.g., GPT-3, T5 or similar large scale generative models)
• Having peer-reviewed publications in NLP or related ML fields is a big plus
• Experience with cloud deployments, focused on automation, scale, performance and reliability
• Having a history of participating in Kaggle competitions is a big plus
• Experience in Python and preferably in C++ or Java or Nodejs
• Excellent communication skills
• Experience with decomposing technical tasks into subtasks and ability to solve them independently
• Ability to work autonomously and complete tasks. We are looking for an independent and proactive team member who would help to build a healthy software engineering culture to provide the basis for future company growth.

We offer:

In SOULA, we focus on an individual approach to our users and employees. And we are ready to discuss the benefits and conditions essential for you to achieve a win-win cooperation format. Welcome aboard!

Contact information:

ceo@soula.care

+35799188876 tel/what’s up

Natallia Miranchuk
A global tech firm specializing in banking systems utilizing AI is joining us in Cyprus with an additional team and office, we are looking for Machine Learning Engineers to join this new venture. }}

Who We Are

Albourne is a global financial services group of companies. Our objective is to advise our clients to be the best investors they can be. The company’s main areas of focus are fund research, portfolio and risk advice, FinTech and implementation. Albourne’s company in Nicosia opened in 1998 and it provides back office and IT services to the regulated companies of the Albourne group; it currently has over 200 dynamic employees and we are looking to have more to join our teams across various functions.

Role in Brief

The purpose of this role is to utilize Albourne's database to research and train Machine Learning models that will improve the efficiency of end-users. As a Machine Learning developer, you will be involved in researching new technologies, that can be utilized to solve business specific problems, work with existing data structures to create datasets that can be used for training and assist in the training and testing of new models.

Insights to the Role
• Creation... of datasets to assist in model training
• Research and develop ML models to solve specific tasks
• Write and monitor machine learning tests
• Assist in expanding the Machine Learning pipelines currently in place
• Research how new state-of-the-art models can solve Company problems
• Evaluating performance of machine learning models
• Training or re-training new and existing models
• Investigate new technologies
• Estimate time required to complete given tasks
• Communicate with business users for development needs
• Adhoc projects upon request
• Pro-actively seek ways to improve maintanability and resilience of systems
• Pro-actively seek ways to improve user experience

Who You Are
• Graduate degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Data science, Mathematics or equivalent
• Understanding of ML frameworks (NLP to be considered an advantage)
• Experience with deep learning frameworks an advantage
• Strong organizational and time management skills
• Strong ability to multi-task and set priorities
• Strong programming skills (Java, Python)
• Comply with terms of Albourne Compliance Manuals
• Attend company events upon request

What We Offer
• Career growth and tools for ongoing learning and development
• Medical insurance for you and your dependents
• Provident fund
• Yearly bonus dependent upon performance and company growth
• Opportunity for international travel (i.e., short periods of secondment to other Albourne offices)
• 5 additional service recognition holidays in surplus to standard annual leave
• Albourne Training Days (minimum of 40 hours per year)
• Free office parking

What You’ll Enjoy
• A supportive, multi-cultural work environment
• Freedom to work independently, problem-solve and come up with creative solutions to complete tasks within required deadlines
• Explore different roles within Albourne after you master your current role. There are excellent opportunities for horizontal and vertical career progression
• Open plan office equipped with kitchen facilities and communal entertainment area
• Fun social activities
• Charity Day – a day in the year to work on a cause you are passionate about
• We are supportive of fitness, mental health and wellness; implementing company-wide sessions for people to partake in activities related to these areas

Albourne embraces diversity and equal opportunity for all its employees.

We are committed to building teams that represent a variety of cultural backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Successful candidates would be required to comply with the terms of Albourne’s compliance manuals and procedures.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted

Job-Title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Machine Learning and Data Science for...
Description:
The Cyprus Institute (CyI) is a European Non-profit Science and Technology oriented Educational and Research Institution based in Cyprus and led by an acclaimed Board of Trustees. The research agenda of the CyI is pursued at its four Research Centres: The Computation-based Science and Technology Research Centre (CaSToRC), the Science and Technology in Archaeology and Culture Research Centre (STARC), the Energy Environment Water Research Centre (EEWRC) and the Climate and Atmosphere Research Centre (CARE-C). Considerable cross-centre interaction is a characteristic of the Institute’s culture.

The Cyprus Institute invites applications for a highly qualified and motivated individual to join the Institute as a Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Machine Learning and Data Science for Climate Science in CaSToRC. The successful candidate will apply Machine Learning for investigating key processes of the Earth System, including (but not limited to) the following:
• Extreme event (weather... temperature, precipitation, etc.) risk detection
• Data-driven and hybrid modeling of the Earth system
• Using machine learning to develop new parameterizations for climate models
• Causal inference in the context of climate change
• Machine learning in support to air quality modelling for exposure mapping, super-resolution, short-term forecasts and long-term projections

The candidate will be working primarily with Prof. Constantine Dovrolis (recently moved to CyI from Georgia Tech -- see http://www.cc.gatech.edu/~dovrolis/) as well as with Prof. Theo Christoudias (http://christoudias.cyi.ac.cy/) and Prof. Johannes Lelieveld.

(https://www.cyi.ac.cy/index.php/care-c/about-the-center/care-c-our-people/itemlist/user/67-jos-lelieveld.html) from CARE-C.

This position offers a unique opportunity for fundamental research and its exact focus will be determined also based the interests and skills of the successful candidate. The successful candidate will also work closely with the PIs in writing relevant grant proposals.

The appointment is for a period of 2 years, with the possibility of renewal subject to performance and the availability of funds. An internationally competitive remuneration package will be offered, which is commensurate with the level of experience of the successful candidate.

Responsibilities/activities to be involved in:
• Development of novel Machine Learning/AI models for the analysis of climate phenomena
• Collection and statistical analysis of observational and model data relevant to atmospheric and climate change, with a special focus on the Eastern Mediterranean and the Middle East (EMME)
• Writing Research Papers in collaboration with the PIs -- aiming to publish at top-tier conferences and journals
• Presentation of results in conferences and meetings and participation in journal publications
• Contribution to research proposal preparation, project (scientific) reporting & project management
• Supervision and guidance of Research Assistants and Students

Required Qualifications
• PhD in computer science, geosciences, physics or a related field (such as computational science, applied math or climate science) at the time of the appointment (The candidate must hold a PhD degree of a recognized higher education institution before the deadline of the opening. Candidates who have successfully defended their doctoral thesis but who have not yet formally been awarded the doctoral degree will also be considered eligible to apply provided that they can document their successful defense of the thesis)
• Publications in the areas of Artificial Intelligence and/or Machine Learning (either developing new methods in these areas -- or applying existing methods in climate science)
• 3 year-experience (including PhD research)
• Understanding of fundamental concepts in climate science
• Proficient programming skills (preferably in Python) and experience with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch
• Ability to work as part of an interdisciplinary team while showing initiative and independence
• Excellent knowledge of the English language (written and verbal)

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience with statistical methods for climate datasets
• Background in atmospheric dynamics, climate modeling

Application

For full consideration, interested applicants should process their application at The Cyprus Institute Exelsys Platform, by clicking the ‘Apply’ button and based on the instructions given.

Applicants should submit a curriculum vitae including a short letter of interest, list of publications and a list of three (3) referees (including contact information) (all documentation should be in English and in PDF Format).

For further information, please contact Prof Constantine Dovrolis (c.dovrolis@cyi.ac.cy).

Please note that applications which do not fulfill the required qualifications and do not follow the announcement’s guidelines will not be considered.

Recruitment will continue until the position is filled.

The Cyprus Institute is an Equal Opportunities Employer certified from the Cypriot Ministry of Labor and also an HRS4R accredited Institution that adheres to the European Commission’s “Charter & Code” principles for recruitment and selection.

Contact person: Prof C. Dovrolis

Reference number: CaSToRC_PDF_22_15

Margera is a boutique analytics agency founded by an x-Googler. We help Enterprise companies grow through the use of data and analytics. We are proud to support top companies in various industries such as banks (Eurobank, Piraeus Bank, Astrobank), travel-related (Aegean Airlines, Sani/ikos Hotels), tobacco (Philip Morris in 6 countries) and gaming (OPAP, Stoiximan, novibet). Our main services are Digital Analytics (we are the only Google Analytics Sales Partner in Greece/Cyprus), Data warehousing (on-prem or on the Cloud), BI and Machine Learning.

We have an ambitious growth plan (x5 in 3 years) and we are looking for a professional who will be joining our Data Analytics Team.

Here’s who we’re looking for:

You are a fresh graduate that wants to start a great career. You must thrive on problem-solving when somebody assigns something challenging to you, you do not say "this cannot be done", but rather "how can this be done?". As a Data Analyst, you will be expected to gather... information from various sources, interpret patterns and trends and conclude to actionable insights.

Typical responsibilities for this role would be:

The primary responsibility of the Data Analyst is to perform analysis that leads to actionable insights based on the needs of our Clients.
• Analysis: Analyse data collected from various data sources, identify new data sources or ways to look at the data, perform the synthesis of insights to generate a coherent story
• Reporting: Design and create reports for periodic or ad-hoc needs
• Development: Assist in data warehousing projects by understanding the semantics of the data and participating in data modeling workshops

We do not care about a prestigious university degree or social connections. We care about raw intellectual capacity and drive.

You must have:
• University degree in Mathematics, Economics (or a similar field)
• Excellent command of the English language
• Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, text functions)
• Data curiosity

Bonus points for:
• Having completed relevant internships
• Knowledge of data-related programming languages (Python, R, etc)
• Strong knowledge of SQL
• Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Qlickview)
• Interest into Machine Learning/AI

BENEFITS

We know that the growth of our company is 100% based on our Team and therefore we are looking for talented and really ambitious people. If you are one of those rare breeds, you will be working with a team of young, smart people in a company with a clear growth mindset.

On top of this, we offer:
• Competitive salary
• Monthly bonus
• Discretionary annual salary increases
• Internal trainings either product specific (like Google Analytics, Microsoft PowerBI) or data in general (SQL, AI/ML foundations).
• Brand new tech equipment (Macbook laptop, big screen, headphones)

If
you want to be in a team that respects you, make an impact with your
projects and learn new technologies and strategies through your work and
trainings, then you should apply today. View more about Margera and learn how we make this happen

About the Company:

CELLOCK (www.cellock.com) is a leading Information Technology SME, founded in 2003, which currently operates around the fields of data analysis, big data, machine learning software and hardware development. With many years of combined experience in software and hardware development and a highly-skilled technical workforce, we pride ourselves as a premier IT company serving clients in diversified business verticals like governmental organizations, airlines and shipping companies.

Job Description

Applications are invited from candidates who possess the necessary qualifications to fill two (2) full-time PHD positions (the positions could lead to a PhD degree at the University of Cyprus) and at Cellock to investigate in the field of "Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence ".The successful candidates will have the opportunity to conduct applied research in the areas of artificial intelligence. They will work with a very active team of researchers.

Requirements... for the PhD position:
• Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics , Statistics , Electrical Engineering, or Computer Engineering) from an accredited institution.
• Excellent programming skills (e.g., C, C++, C#, Python, Java), mathematical maturity, and ability to learn quickly.
• Experience in Machine / Deep Learning will be considered an advantage.
• Previous research experience and high impact research publications will be considered an advantage.
• Language requirements: Excellent written and oral English-language skills will be required.

Location & Hours of Work:

Our office is in Nicosia, Cyprus.

The position is full-time i.e. 38 hours per week, Monday to Friday, Remote working is acceptable also but we are looking for candidates with permanent address in Cyprus only

Remuneration & Benefits:

The salary will depend on qualifications and experience.

The holiday entitlement is 22 days per year (plus national holidays

About the jobCRYT is a new crypto exchange platform, founded by market leaders of the traditional finance industry to address the existing frustrations in the crypto industry in regard to simplicity and transparency. We believe crypto is the natural evolution in the future of transfer of value for the world's economy. However, the adoption will not happen if crypto trading remains a complex and opaque domain, available and understood only by fintech-savvy individuals.Our mission is to bring simplicity and transparency to the crypto ecosystem, contributing to its adoption by facilitating the onboarding and education of the average Joe.Our general technology accents are modularity, simplicity, and security. We are looking for like-minded software engineers to join our technology team, either remotely or onsite in our dev hub in Limassol where we will relocate you and your family. The position we are opening is a data engineer who will join us to build storage, transformation and... representation solutions with our internal data. The technology team is small, so we collaborate tightly and horizontally in a native agile manner.What we want you to do:●Own the data domain in the engineering●Design, deploy and maintain the ‘big data’ in company:○Data lake with various unstructured data (market data, user journey & behavior data etc)○Data marts with aggregated datasets○Data pipelines with and within digital marketing cloud solutions●Perform ad-hoc exploratory analysis across multiple large data sets●Work in a team and take responsibility for your workWhat you need to have:●Cloud-native experience data domain●5+ years of commercial software engineering as engineer●Analytical skills over unstructured data●Experience with message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores●Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases●Experience with performance and workload managementBenefits:●Bonus structure for each job role●Relocation to Cyprus with all the necessary support for you and your family●Gesy insurance and Private medical insurance for employee and family members●Paid rental car, gym, school for kids and annual training allowance for you●Quarterly team building and yearly events to get to know each other better●Paternity & Maternity gift

About this position:
As a Data Scientist you will act as a mixture of data analyst and researcher. Results of the work vary from recipes on how to extract and utilize insights from internet-scale datasets to ML models prototyping. Basic familiarity with applied ML engineering is a plus.

In this role, you will:
• Adopt industry best practices and worldwide best practices in Data Science to the IOW problems
• Test, modify and apply Data Science and especially Machine learning ideas on huge (internet-scale) datasets.
• Apply IOW tools (u-Predict, u-CS etc) in day-to-day work on expert level;
• Build, test and document prototypes to prove ways of utilizing (to solve industry and IOW business problems) obtained insights.
• Research limitations of these ideas/MVPs/etc
Ideal candidate will have:
• Education in computer science, applied mathematics, physics or similar
• Experience with ML tools: sklearn or similar.
• Experience with Neural Networks tools: tensorflow, pytorch or similar is a... plus
• Experience in distributed big data processing: Hadoop, Spark etc is a plus
• Decent SQL knowledge, is a plus
• Knowledge of mathematics, probability theory
• Experience with a scripting language (preferably python), experienced *nix system user
• Analytical, logical, and good problem solver (experience with math/programming contests is a plus)
• Knowledge and experience with online advertising (RTB ecosystem) as a plus
• Good written English

What we offer:
• Exciting career opportunity with international exposure at one of the pioneers in Ad Tech and Programmatic
• Open and approachable management team with strong engineering DNA
• Internal career development pathways, supported by a Performance Management System
• Flexible approach to working hours and location
• Professional development and training opportunities
• Corporate English learning courses
• Comprehensive health and wellness benefits for employees and family members
• Life and accident insurance
• Mental health resources and support
• Generous PTO and parental leave policy
• Recognition of employee milestones
• Employee referral bonus program
• Relocation benefits for employees from other countries

Additional information:
• Diversity & Inclusion: IPONWEB is committed to building a diverse workforce and fostering an inclusive working environment for all of our employees. We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to sex, race, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, or genetics. IPONWEB complies with local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates.
• Remote working policy: According to the Work From Home policy, we expect employees to be in the office at least 1 day per week for company or client meetings; we also provide up to 4 weeks for work from anywhere each year.
• Our tech stack: We’re a tech company at heart, so we know how important it is for engineers to work with technology that’s exciting to them. Here’s a sneak peek into our stack so you can judge for yourself.
• High performance HTTP servers: C++ / Java / Go
• OS: Ubuntu
• Custom business logic: Lua / Python / TypeScript
• Datastores: MongoDB / Cassandra
• Data processing and ML modules: Spark / Java / Scala
• Flexible APIs: Python / Django / Go
• UIs: Angular / TypeScript
• Hosting: AWS / GCP
• CI/CD: GitLab CI
• Monitoring: Graphite / Grafana / Prometheus / Zabbix
• Logs transformation: Hadoop / Spark / Java / Apache

Job Overview

As a part of Creative Research team, you will work in the intersection of game development and data science areas. Your role will be to deliver state-of-the-art Machine Learning solutions for our game development processes.

The ideal candidate won’t just help us to increase our analytical tasks but will bring a new knowledge and experience to the team. As a subject matter expert, you will be working in close collaboration with game teams to identify, prototype and implement solutions to change the game production and player experience.

We are looking for a new team member with strong interpersonal skills and a combination of analytical skills, intellectual curiosity and accountability.

Job content

Analyze data and apply researching, designing, implementing, and deploying full-stack scalable data analytics vision and machine learning solutions to challenge various business issues.

Prepare analytical reports in a simple, understandable way for a business or technical... audience. Develop specifications for created models for further automation.

The ideal candidate is intelligent, sharp, detail-oriented, and highly quantitative individual with a passion for gaming, data modeling, analysis, and working with cross-functional teams.

What will you do?
• Design, prototype, and implement advanced machine learning algorithms to help improve player experiences. Work with engineering team to implement robust processes in real time
• Frame and conduct intricate analyses and experiments using extremely large, complex (not always well-structured, highly variable) data sets, analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
• Create statistical models that provide insights and direction for overall game feature design and level design
• Develop tools and processes that will help data scientists and stakeholders more efficiently generate data insight through our very rich game data
• Check and debug any data-related issues to ensure accuracy and data integrity
• Build automated data flows
• Work in close collaboration with game teams to identify and prototype projects involving Machine Learning features
• Research, implement and improve Machine Learning solutions to improve our game production processes or players experience
• Collaborate with other data scientists and engineers to industrialize Machine Learning solutions into innovative products and business processes
• Review relevant academic and industry research to identify useful algorithms, techniques, libraries, etc. Monitor latest Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence trends and cutting-edge technics to leverage them on our projects
• Collaborate with worldwide and local stakeholders to share ideas, best practices and methodologies
• Present information using data visualization techniques to both technical and non-technical team members

What are we looking for?
• Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (applied mathematics, statistics or data mining)
• Ability to work with both structured and unstructured data
• Knowledge of probability theory and mathematical statistics
• Working knowledge of clustering, discriminant and regression analysis, time series analysis and other data mining and machine learning algorithms
• Hands-on experience building and implementing predictive models using machine learning algorithms and tools solving regression and classification problems
• Working knowledge of Python programming language
• Advanced knowledge of SQL
• Teamwork experience
• Intermediate or higher level of English

What additional skills will help you stand out?
• Experience in game development industry
• Experience with Reinforcement Learning, Generative Adversarial Network, NLP and other state of the art techniques
• Experience with Tensorflow/Pytorch, numpy, scipy, cuda
• Experience with other programming languages (R, C++, C#, etc.)
• Experience working with big data
• Experience with cloud data/data processing services
• Working knowledge of BI tools, BA tools or DWH
• Advanced data visualization skills
• Experience in creating analytical reports in English and Russian

We are proud to announce this exciting
new opening for a Data Engineer or Data Scientist to join one of Europe’s
fastest growing companies according to the

VACANCY FOR DATA ANALYST

2023/02

Medicover Genetics (formerly NIPD Genetics) is a leading innovative biotechnology company based in Cyprus, active in the field of designing, developing, producing and providing in vitro genetic testing solutions. Medicover Genetics’ proprietary technology platform and bioinformatics solutions cover all types of genetic conditions in any part of the human genome and apply to many applications from routine DNA analysis to complex, proprietary non-invasive testing solutions like NIPT and Liquid Biopsy. Medicover Genetics offers advanced genetic testing services in over 30 countries in Europe, Asia and Africa. Medicover Genetics is part of Medicover, a leading international healthcare and diagnostic services company founded in 1995 and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm (www.medicover.com).

THE POSITION

We seek to recruit an enthusiastic and driven individual with a background in Machine Learning, Bioinformatics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or... similar, to join our dynamic team of scientists.

The successful candidate will work in an interdisciplinary environment and will help in data analysis, workflow automation and the development and implementation of suitable models in the field of diagnostics.

JOB DESCRIPTION
• Responsible for analytical aspects of diagnostic tests as well as the development and implementation of statistical analysis and machine learning methods for diagnostic operations
• Responsible for the computational analysis and the bioinformatics support for all research operations
• Contributing to the verification/validation of the test procedures and provide counselling on statistical matters and procedures to the management
• Assisting in the development of software and custom scripts to automate data retrieval and analysis and ensure compliance with accreditation requirements
• Big data management
• Install and configure solutions (DevOps engineer)
• Assisting in the development of software and custom scripts to automate data storage, data retrieval and ensure compliance with accreditation requirements

REQUIREMENTS
• University degree in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Computer Science, or closely related fields
• Candidates must have strong analytical skills, and be proficient with Unix/Linux command line environments, as well as experienced in programming in one or more of the following programming languages: Python, R or C++

The following will be considered an advantage:
• Masters or PhD degree in relevant field
• Experience in molecular biology and genetics
• Experience with next generation sequencing data analysis
• Familiar with High Performance Computing
• Experience in parallel programming
• Experience with relational databases (e.g. MySQL)
• Good communication skills

APPLICATIONS:

To apply please forward your application with subject: 2023/02 – Data Analyst at the following e-mail address: hr@nipd.com. Your application should include a detailed curriculum vitae and the names of two referees.

For further information, please contact the Human Resources Department at Tel. 22266888 or visit nipd.com.

Medicover Genetics is an Equal Opportunities Employer. All applications will be handled as strictly confidential

Job-Title: Presales Solution Consultant (Big Data, Analytics, AI/ML)
Description:
Cyprus-based InDataLabs – a leading company in AI custom solutions engineering, is looking for an experienced Presales Solutions Consultant to drive value for prospective customers through the combination of strong technical expertise and outstanding interpersonal and presentation skills.

You’ll work with clients from a range of industries on diverse use cases, and with both business (executive, line of business) and technical (data science, engineering, analytics) stakeholders.

Within our team, you will be the key link between Sales Managers, Solution Architects, Data Scientists and Data Engineers ensuring success throughout the entire sales process.

Job content:
• Engage with clients to understand their business goals, data challenges and desired outcomes from business programs and technology solutions
• Influence customers by translating complex technical terms/processes into business value
• Lead presales activities during complete sales cycle – Customer meetings, Architecture... discussions, Proof of Concepts, Demos, building ROI/TCO
• Play a key role in preparing proposals and bids for SMB and Enterprise opportunities
• Create compelling customized presentations tailored to customers use case
• Continuously build solid presentation skills, content and a deep understanding of Cloud, Data & AI technologies and how to position winning solution

Desired Competency and Experience:

Commercial (presales OR engineering) experience with the following solutions:
• Data science, custom ML/AI, Cloud ML
• Big data, data lakes, data architecture, data analytics
• Cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, AZURE, etc.)

General understanding of:
• APIs, Integrations, Security
• Microservices architecture, containerized infrastructure
• 4+ years of experience in a technical consulting role in Data Science/predictive modeling (Data Scientists who want to move to customer facing role are very welcomed)
• Experience in customer facing role (preferably with SMB/enterprise customers)
• Experience delivering business value to customers with Big Data, Machine learning solutions. Ability to develop a solid understanding of customers’ business needs and technical requirements in order to map that information to a solution that meets their needs
• Experience of selling a technical value proposition, communicating technical capabilities and complex ideas
• Experience with Pre-sales activities, RFPs, proposal preparation for international clients
• Understanding the processes of business verticals and horizontal functions (agriculture, insurance or healthcare or supply chain)
• Excellent client facing, business consulting and communication skills
• Ability to present competently and confidently to senior-level decision makers
• Ability to handle business and technical objections from customers
• Strong problem-solving capabilities with a ‘get it done’ attitude, working cross-functionally and with the customer to overcome technical hurdles
• Attention to detail and quality
• Fluent English (additional language would be a plus – German, French, Spanish)

Join our team of world-class data scientists and data engineers, and challenge yourself with some of the most pressing analytics and engineering tasks of modern times

Are you a data wizard passionate about turning raw data into valuable insights? We're looking for a highly skilled data engineer to join our team and help drive our data-driven strategy.

As a data engineer at our company, you'll be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the data pipelines that power our business. You'll work closely with our data scientists, analysts, and engineers to ensure that our data is accurate, reliable, and easily accessible.

Key responsibilities:
• Design, build, and maintain data pipelines for various data sources
• Optimize data pipeline performance and scalability
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
• Ensure data quality and accuracy by implementing data validation processes

Requirements:
• Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP
• Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra)
• Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies... (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes)
• Familiarity with data governance and data security best practices
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
• Strong communication and collaboration skills
• Ability to work independently and in a fast-paced environment
• Bonus: Experience with machine learning and data science frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, sci-kit-learn)

Our company believes in empowering our employees to drive innovation and make a real impact. If you're ready to join a team of talented individuals and make your mark on the world of data, we want to hear from you! Apply today, and let's build something amazing together.

About Lab4crypto

At Lab4crypto, we are a team of academic experts in blockchain and artificial intelligence with a passion for helping businesses leverage these cutting-edge technologies to solve real-world problems.

With decades of combined experience in blockchain and AI, our team has a proven track record of delivering innovative solutions that drive growth and increase efficiency.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and professional development and growth opportunities. We encourage you to apply if you are passionate about blockchain and want to make a real impact.

Are you looking for the next professional opportunity, that will challenge you and advance your career? Join our team now!

Tickmill is looking to hire Data Engineer to join our rapidly expanding Quantitative Research team.

Join a high-caliber team and contribute to its success with your passion, hard-work and positive attitude.

About Tickmill.

Tickmill is an award-winning, multi-regulated broker offering a wide range of asset classes including CFDs on Forex, Stocks, Indices, Commodities, Cryptocurrencies and bonds, as well as Exchange Traded Derivatives (Futures & Options).

The Tickmill Group was established in 2014, and employs over 250 individuals through its offices in London, Cyprus, Estonia, South Africa and several other regional offices globally.

Our philosophy is based on trust, transparency, and diversity, reflected in both our workplace culture and outstanding customer support. Our employees, a multilingual team of highly skilled professionals from every... continent, are the backbone of the company. Their hard work and dedication are what makes it possible to rank among the best in the industry. Tickmill offers a competitive benefits package, hybrid work model, team-building events, and many opportunities for professional growth.

What the job looks like?

Having access to an extensive big data platform we perform research on systematic trading and find patterns in noisy real-world data sets. We are expanding our team and we are looking for a Data Engineer.

The successful candidate will be part of the Quantitative Research team and be responsible for the design and the implementation of our inhouse or cloud-based data managements systems. Will be focus on building state-of-the-art data solutions and developing both frontend and backend implementations for our software applications. She/He will be responsible for the sustainability and maintenance of our relational and timeseries data storing systems but also for the monitoring and the integrity of their data. Strong affinity for data exploration/visualization and experience in working with data formats JSONs, CSVs, XMLs are required.

The exceptional candidate once selected, will collaborate with high caliber team and help in the efficient development of machine learning techniques for predicting price movements in the FX, Commodities, Futures and Equities Space.

What will you need to be able to do the job?
• BSc or MSc in a STEM subject (mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering).
• Minimum 2 years of experience in Data Science, Big Data or Data Analytics.
• Experience in working with Linux-based systems is a necessity.
• Experience with RDBMS (Oracle, MS SQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc)
• Knowledge of high-level programming languages such as Python/R/Go/C++.
• Experience in Python packages such as numpy and pandas is preferable.
• Experience in designing and development of automated data management processes.
• Knowledge of AWS, Google Cloud or Azure services.
• Experience in Data Preparation & Ingestion will be considered as a benefit.
• Experience with Timeseries DBs (Influx, TimescaleDB, etc) will be considered as an advantage.
• Interested in continuous research and be always creative with innovative ideas.
• Excellent knowledge of the English Language both written and oral.
• Professionalism and work ethic, Self-motivation and a Desire to succeed.

By joining us, you can expect:
• A Unique Opportunity for a career in a global, fast-growing company.
• Attractive remuneration packagebased on qualifications and experience (including 13th salary and Discretionary Bonuses to reward exceptional performance).
• Opportunities to learn and growthrough our “Employee Training & Development program”.
• A great chance to focus on your Health and Wellnessthrough a Free Gym membership (Sanctum Spa & Fitness @Limassol Marina) and Medical Insurance Cover, which includes Outpatient, Inpatient, and Dental Care.
• Multiple events to bond with the team and the groupthrough Quarterly/Semestrial Team Activities for all the Company.
• Participation in our welfare investment and savings plan through our Provident Fund Scheme.
• Working Hours 09:00-18:00 (1 hr. lunch break) from Monday – Friday.

Make your next Career step and apply NOW!
• Due to the great number of applications, we receive for each of our open vacancies, we are unable to respond on an individual basis.

Margera is a boutique analytics agency founded by an x-Googler. We help Enterprise companies grow through the use of data and analytics. We are proud to support top companies in various industries such as banks (Eurobank, Piraeus Bank, Astrobank), travel-related (Aegean Airlines, Sani/ikos Hotels), tobacco (Philip Morris in 6 countries) and gaming (OPAP, Stoiximan, novibet). Our main services are Digital Analytics (we are the only Google Analytics Sales Partner in Greece/Cyprus), Data warehousing (on-prem or on the Cloud), BI and Machine Learning.

We have an ambitious growth plan (x5 in 3 years) and we are looking for a professional who will be joining our Data Engineering Team.

Typical responsibilities for this role would be
• Participating in all aspects of data platform lifecycle, including high level design, architecture definition, implementation, testing and deployment.
• Curating complex datasets to prepare for either ML modeling or to be used for analytical work
• Designing... and building ETL pipelines to include data from a wide variety of sources.
• Work collaboratively within cross-functional Teams (Analysts, Account Manager, Client Managers)
• Implement solutions on the Cloud (we work on all 3 Clouds, AWS/GCP/Azure)
• Work with tools and technologies such as Python, SQL, Google BQ, Data Studio, ML libraries

We do not care about a prestigious university degree or social connections. We care about raw intellectual capacity and drive.

You must have:
• University degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or similar
• Good knowledge of Python
• Strong knowledge of SQL
• Excellent command of the English language

Bonus points for:
• Having completed relevant internships
• Strong understanding of relational databases
• Experience with ML models

Benefits:

We know that the growth of our company is 100% based on our Team and therefore we are looking for talented and really ambitious people. If you are one of those rare breeds, you will be working with a team of young, smart people in a company with a clear growth mindset.

On top of this, we offer:
• Competitive compensation
• Monthly bonus
• Discretionary annual salary increases
• Internal trainings either product specific (like Google Analytics, Microsoft PowerBI) or data in general (SQL, AI/ML foundations).
• Brand new tech equipment (Macbook laptop, big screen, headphones)

If you want to be in a team that respects you, make an impact with your projects and learn new technologies and strategies through your work and trainings, then you should apply today. View more about Margera and learn how we make this happen

World of Tanks development team is looking for a specialist for the position of Game developer (AI).

As part of the team, you will improve, optimize and support the game engine AI implementation and its creation tools for World of Tanks PC. You will be working in a mixed-skillset Engineers team on the WoT product and AI core features in collaboration with the colleagues from other Wargaming studios. That includes both low-level AI core system features with you being involved in defining and expanding the AI core development vision and future features, as well as working on application-level features needed for the WoT product itself.

The teams are distributed geographically but share the same time zone.

You will report to the team’s Producer and Solution Architect with your day-to-day tasks and activities.

What will you do?
• Work closely with game designers to transform their AI-related artistic vision, ideas and requests into working tech in our product
• Implement state-of-the... art AI tech and features to significantly enhance the players’ experience
• Keep the product code well-optimized and performing on the vast variety of the supported hardware

What are we looking for?
• 2+ years of professional experience working on AI
• AI concepts, tools and architecture (behavior trees, goal-based agents, etc.)
• C++17 programming language
• Mathematics background (logic, linear algebra, geometry, statistics and probability, etc.)
• Scripting languages experience (Python, Lua, any will do)
• Intermediate or higher English level
• Russian language skills on Pre-Advanced level

What additional skills will help you stand out?
• Passion for games and desire to develop in game development
• World of Tanks playing experience

Job-Title: Funded PhD position in Machine Learning at Frederick University, Cyprus
Description:
The Department of Computer Science and Engineering of Frederick University (www.frederick.ac.cy) invites applications for up to two(2) funded PhD positions within the research topic of machine learning. These positions are part of a close research collaboration between the University's Computational Intelligence (COIN) Laboratory and Albourne Partners (Cyprus) Limited and its Group (www.albourne.com).

Albourne is one of the world's leading providers of independent high-quality research and advice on complicated assets. The successful applicants will perform research on intelligent data analysis and the development of machine learning techniques for applied problems within the Albourne Group under the supervision of Dr Harris Papadopoulos. An important focus of the work will be the provision of well-calibrated confidence information in machine learning predictions.

Funding

The funding comprises tuition fees for the PhDprogram and a contract of employment with Albourne Partners... (Cyprus) Limited, remunerated at the rate of Euro 1000.00 gross per month.

Qualifications

The ideal applicants should have a master's degree in engineering, computer science or applied mathematics. They should have a good background in mathematics, statistics, and programming (Java, MatLab), coupled with scientific curiosity and good communication skills. Good knowledge of the English language is required.

The applicants must be eligible under Cyprus legislation to be employed by a company in Cyprus.

Application Procedure and deadlines

Applications should include:
• a short (up to one page) motivation letter;
• current extended Curriculum Vitae;
• name and contact details for two referees, at least one of which should be an academic; and
• any other supporting material (e.g. publications).

Applications will be accepted until all twopositions are filled. Only successful candidates will be contacted and invited for interviews. Employment by Albourne Partners (Cyprus) Ltd will be subject to satisfactory completion of background screening checks.

Albourne embraces diversity and equal opportunity for all its employees.

We are committed to building teams that represent a variety of cultural backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Successful candidates would be required to comply with the terms of Albourne’s compliance manuals and procedures.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted
